clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of 5 Weeks of Treatment With BGG492 in Patients With Spasticity Due to Multiple Sclerosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo Controlled, Parallel-group Study to Assess the Efficacy of 5 Weeks of Treatment With BGG492 in Patients With Spasticity Due to Multiple Sclerosis

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate efficacy and safety of BGG492 versus placebo on moderate to severe spasticity due to multiple sclerosis

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in spasticity NRS score from baseline to 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: The spasticity Numeric Rating Scale is a 0 to 10 patient reported scale of spasticity severity, with 0 being no spasticity and 10 being worst possible spasticity.

The Patient Global Impression of Change is a patient reported one item mesaure of overall improvement in condition since the previous visit. The patient is asked to choose one of 7 sentences from very much improved to very much worse, that best describes his present condition.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to 5 weeks in Ashworth spasticity score
secondary_outcome.description: The Ashworth spasticity score is a physician assessed rating of spasticity using a five point score from 0 to 4 for each muscle group tested.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: average of 70 days, maximum from day -19 to day 52, i.e. from first baseline up to study completion visit
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with adverse events (AE).

clinical_study.condition: Muscle Spasticity Due to Multiple Sclerosis

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of multiple sclerosis (MS) of any type.
- MS diagnosis at least 6 months prior to screening.
- Stable MS with no relapse within 3 months prior to screening.
- Treated or untreated spasticity due to MS for at least 3 months prior to screening, not wholly relieved with antispasticity medications.
Key exclusion criteria:
- Patients with symptoms of spasticity not due to MS.
- Patients taking three or more different anti-spasticity medications.
- Acute MS exacerbation requiring treatment within 3 months of the Screening Visit.
- Initiation of, or the discontinuation of interferon beta or any other disease modifying therapy for MS within 3 months of the Screening Visit.
- Use of baclofen pump at any time.
- Wheelchair or bed-bound patients.
